text: Bottle thanks to Fergus, shared at Leightons 20K tasting. It pours cloudy bright orange with a thick white head. The aroma isrich, lactcic, tangy, tart, sour, cheesecake, smoke action and earth. The taste is crisp, tart, tangy, sour, creamy, lactic, smoked malts, cheesecake, earth and toasty grain. Medium body and fien carbonation. An interesting combination thats for sure. Jester somehow make it work.

750mL bottle. Pours a hazy pale orangey amber with a medium, foamy off-white head that quickly settles into a small lasting head. Aroma is very smoky - peat, wood, and meat - and somewhat herbal; also notes of light yeast and hints of lemon. Taste is smoky sausage and lightly sour orange with tangerine, some salt, yoghurt, and cereal, and light spice. Lasting smoky wheat finish with some herbal bitterness (from the sweet gale, maybe?). Dry. Medium body. Medium carbonation. Smooth mouthfeel.

UPDATED: APR 18, 2017 750ml bottle. Cloudy, orangey golden colour with average, frothy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, white head. Smoky, slightly herbal-spicy, tart-ish aroma, hints of beech wood, sauerkraut, sage, yoghurt. Taste is tart and smoky, lactic, notes of sauerkraut, spare ribs, a herbal touch of sage, some yoghurt. Since I have no idea of an "authentic" Gotlandsdricka, this one would go as Grätzer for me as well.
light hazy orange. Aroma of smoke (and light meat), pit fruit. Lightly sour/tart smoked flavor with light spices. Cool and unique.

At a tasting, many thanks rayaron, Very little head, cloudy and a bit intense apricot orange color, mellow exquisite smokiness, and biscuity malt aroma, meloow smokey flavor with lots of yoghurt, sour fruit, lemon zest amd a woody hint. Wonderfull.

Bottle shared at a tasting at zvsns place. Slightly hazy orange with white head. The aroma is quite smoked with notes of sausage, light sourness, salted snack. Sourish flavor, spicy and smoked with notes of sausage and yogurt, well balanced. Medium-bodied. Amazing beer!

Bottle sample a tasting, thanks rayaron! Batch #5. Hazy orange golden with a huge head. Great smoky aroma with notes of berries, flowers, herbs, citrus. Moderately sweet, tart, lactic, flavors of malt, citrus, lemon peel, tropical fruits, herbs, berries, great balance. Medium-bodied, smooth. Yummy!

March 1st 2017Leightons 20K at his posh new gaff! Thanks to Fergus. Hazy gold beer, big fluffy cream colour head. Palate is light, dry and finely crisp. Smooth malts. White smoke. Lemony sourness, mild acid. Touch of orange citrus. Spice. Light dry bitter crisp finish. Not bad, in fact pretty tolerable for a smoky sour.

750ml bottle obtained in a trade. Pours out golden orange. Hazy with a foamy/fizzy white head. Lasting head with good sized bubbles. Carbonation seems good. Smells very peaty/smoky like an Islay scotch. Surprised by how powerful this peat is. Also has that apricot sour fruity scent. A little winey on the back end as well. Pleasant. Nice smooth sour taste to it. Light fruits and a strong peaty finish. Very special flavor. The combination of peaty smokiness and sour fruits works pretty well. Its good but I dont know how much I can have of it. It starts smooth and sour with a nice fruity profile on it and then you swallow and get that pure peatiness throughout combined with a small tart. Good mouthfeel. Full and properly carbonated. Good aftertaste. Enjoyable.

St Davids Day 2017 - Bottle share at Leightons 20K. Many congrats! As Jester King Gotlandsdricka. Cheers Fergus! Hazy orange, opaque, foamy white head leaves light lacing. Aroma is smokey, also some cardboard box. Body is light and frothy with tingly carbonation. Taste is smooth rounded malts, restrained smoke, minerally, dry into the finish. Smooth drinking. (3.7)

Bottle (750 ml), split 2-ways. Thanks to mathieuc, for this bottle! Batch #2, bottled 12.09.2014 so 2+ years old by now. Clear bright orangey-golden with a medium-high white head, good retention, leaving little lacing. Aroma is of wild yeast and meaty smoke with bright citrus and light cereals. Taste is tart and citric but never overly sour with meaty smoke, citrus/oranges, zesty notes and cereals. Medium body, but on the light-ish side. Moderate-medium carbonation. Zesty tart finish with never overpowering meaty smoke aftertaste. A bit of alcohol warmth as well. The smoke is always there and upfront but never overpowering everything else as the wild yeast and tart citrus presence balances it quite well. Rather easy drinking. In really good shape for a 2+ years beer. Tasty!

75cl bottle shared at Leightons Penthouse for his 20K. Special thanks to Fergus for this beer. It pours a hazed golden color with a small white head. Aroma is smokey sour and citric with notes of sea salt and smoked. Taste is also rich and smokey salty sweet fruity Citric. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, nice one

Bottle shared in London for the 20k - cheers! Pours lightly hazy orange with a frothy, white head. The nose has some dry smoke, citrus peel. Light-medium sweet flavour, lemon peel, dry smoke. Light to medium bodied with fine to average carbonation. Decent balance in the finish, more dry smoke, lemon rind. Insides with more dry smoke, lemon peel. Enjoyable stuff.

Bottle shared at Leightons 20k out in hipster central. Thanks to the Fergus for this one. Pours hazy orange gold with a thin white head. Aroma is smoky orange with a little grain. Taste is smoky, sour with a little Marmalade. Couldnt chug lots of this

Bottle shared at the Leighton mega 20k tasting. 1/03/2017. A hazed golden orange coloured pour with a a lasting loose white head. Aroma is big smoked malts, beach smoke, sour malts, salt and lemon. Flavour is composed of sour bitter malts, salt, bitter lemon, smoked malts, peat. Palate is tart lemon, highish carbonation. Interesting. Reminds me of a siren beer.
Panda bottle sample thanks to richthevillan, cheers Rich. Golden beer with small head. Aroma of smoke and floral notes. Taste is smoke, Bavarian cheese, malts and some herbal notes. Good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text:
Bottle split at Clink, Bingohame, thanks to Rich the Villain 26/11/16.
Clear golden pour with a decent off white head.
Nose is smoked malts, light pissoi, grains, lemon drizzle, light musted wood, funk.
Taste comprises singed grass, tangy fruit esters, smokey linger, charred wood, spice, damp hay.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close.
Decent enough offering.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Pours hazy yellow. Bit of foam but not too much. Very smokey nose but things are coming out also from beneath the smoke. Malt and fruits, even some melon. Smoke is not too harsh, quite balanced. Tastes sour. Wow, not very sour but sour enough. Creamy, acidic, loaded with juniper and smoke. Dry finish, fruity white wine-ish dryness. Confusing beer. So multy-layered. Loving it though. Campfire smoke afteraroma in the glass.

Medium orange color. Massively smokey nose with tons of gouda cheese. Sour, smokey, lots of rye and tart mouth but very light and malty. I would like to see an imperial version of this. Awesome.  Batch 5 and it is 5.7%

0,75l bottle at a friends party. Bottled 04.21.2016. Orange cloudy colour, small white head. smells earthy, lightly smoked, juniper, sausage, lightly sour, bit citric, bit herbal. nice smell. Full Body, Medium carbonation, duck mouthfeel. tastes lightly citric, earthy, some yeast, light smoke, spices, light peach, some peat, lightly leathery. finishes lightly sour with notes of citrus, earthy notes and lightly leathery. weird but also rather drinkable. the light sour / citric notes make this rather refreshing. probably best to drink is rather cold. overall good stuff.

Bottle from Cottreridge Wines shared with Cloin, Rich, Jay and Chaz; pretty fucking cloudy pour, aroma has light floral along with hints of smoke, taste has smoked cheese with the brown rhind action, some blossom, a bit strange, but I was expecting that.
750ml bottle. Hazy orange shade. White head. Smoked meat and berry aroma. Tart, juicy taste. Smoke is a lighter accent. Not what I was expecting at all, but supremely balanced and drinkable.

On tap at Jester King. Pours a cloudy yellow with small white head that lasts. The aroma is strong smoke, pepper, funk, lemon zest. Thick mouth, strong pepper, yeast, funky, smoked meat, light tartness, very good.

Pours a dark cloudy yellow with minimum bubbly head. Initial blasts of barbecue smoke, sausage, BBQ sauce aroma. Tastes nice and smokey, barbecuey that subsides and lets the sour, juniper come through with the smoke still there but more subtle. Interesting and enjoyable beer.
CBC2015, Pours yellow with no head, aroma of smoke, vanilla, grain, flavor is slightly sour with smoke and grain, medium bodied
Bottle opened at Todds. Clean yellow color followed by junipers and a lot of smoke. Not for me. Too odd.

Pours hazy apricot with a fairly thick and frothy eggshell head. Aroma offers pomme fruit, fresh malt and yeasty tones. Flavor adds some smoky, almost bacon-like character to the mix. Firm body delivers good fizz. Whatever you wanna call it, downright tasty.

Pours cloudy yellow with a largebp, full white head. Taste is citrus tart, berry fruitiness, lemon, light smoke.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cloudy beige / yellow pour, decent off white head. Nose is yeast and smoke. Beer is sour and smoke across the tongue, some herbs and melons laying in wait. Finish is a friendly wrestle between tartness and smoke; smoke subtly prevails. Worth the search.
Horse piss and smoke nose. Cloudy dark yellow color. Strong carbonation. Light mouthfeel. Smoke and salt flavor

My first smoked beer in a while. Had it sitting in a deep dark cave (my closet). Aroma is soft and smokey and not overpowering like some smoked beers. I was expecting a slightly darker beer but its a nice hazy gold. Taste is a soft tartness with a hint of smoke. Had a nice after taste. Need to find another btl of this.

Bottle with huge thanks to SudsMcDuff! Pours quite hazy orange, medium diminishing off-white head, decent lacing. Aroma is hardwood smoke, lemon, juniper, quite herbal. Flavor is dry, light plus tart, light plus smoky, juniper and a strong citrus note, herbal here as well. Light body. This beer is really interesting and highly enjoyable. Glad I had a chance to try it!
Bottle from Craigs, dregs run. Pours hazy gold with a thin white head. Aromas of light smoke, light sour, lemon, saline. Taste is all of the preceding. Smoky juniper sour finish. Interesting.
Bottle at craigs. Pours hazy yellow, nose is citrus, spices, floral, taste is similar, salty, light sour finish.

Fairly grey golden, straw haziness and a really decent white cap and rounded lacing. Nose is grassy, limey and savoury smoke. Initial taste is a rich dewy soft floral and a decent dunt of soft smokiness. Carbonation is very firm, lean and swift mouthfeel. Finishes clean enough for the Queen, soft oily salty smoke linger. Bottle fae Father Tad, Pig Our Tasting.
Pours cloudy yellow with a largebp, full white head. Taste is citrus tart, berry fruitiness, lemon, light smoke.
Bottle at home Light hazy yellow.. Thin white lacing... Soft sweet bready fruits.. Lightest smoke funk... Over fizzy.. Zezty lemon.. Soft smoke.. Soft fruits
Really nice aroma of smoke and funk. Flavors were tart citrus, smoky wood, slightly acidic with a bite at the end. Nice light peach color with a medium weight with a little pucker. Very unique.

Golden colour with some slight haze, minor head. Aroma is smoked and some sweet malts. Flavour is smoked, some spruce, mild wood and some slight floral notes to it. Also a bit leathery. OK as such, but not much to do with a real Gotlandsdricke.

Une bouteille à Oak St. Draft House): Une fumée vraiment expressive séchappe du goulot avec quelques épices modestes. En bouche on y ajoute du blé machable et une infusion lactique. Très divertissant.
On tap at CBC15. Golden with little head. Aroma is strong smoke, grain, herbs and citrus. Taste is crisp and smoky, citrus, pale malt and grain.

May 1, 2015. On tap at CBC2015, blue session. 
Cloudy yellow with a small off-white head. Aroma is smoked meat, notes of smoked juniper bush, earthy, herbal, sweet grain notes and some lemon. Taste is light tart, medium sweet and some smoked notes. Finish is tart lemon, light bitter earthy, woody and herbal, sweet grainy and smokey. 
Medium bodied, average carbonation.
From tap at CBC 2015. Hazy yellow colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of salt, smoke, fruit, malt and spice.
Draft @ CBC 2015. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity malty weak smoky aroma. Fruity malty smoky weak acidic flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy smoky finish.
CBC. Yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, smoke and meat. Flavour is malt, smoke, meat, sweet, little acid and a little dry.

Pours a cloudy pale yellowish color with fizzy off-white head. Smoked peat, smoked malt, a hint of citrus, tartness, and some funk on the nose; follows onto the palate. Medium bodied, yet chewy. Finishes smoky, with a little tartness, and dry. Much better than batch 1.

750mL bottle, pours a cloudy yellow with a small white head. Aroma bonds out lots of peated smoke, like a German rauchbier. Flavour is tart and smoky, with ashpit-like smoke, tart citrus, and light funk. Well-balanced and cohesive. Not the most complex beer, but its very well-made. Good.

Tap @CBC2015
Golden color, no head. Strong smokey aroma. Light-bodied. Crisp, citrusy, pale malty. Smokey tart flavor, interesting but really not much to do with authentic Gotlandsdricka.
CBC. Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, smoked, peated and fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and light acidic. Sweet finish. 010515

750ml bottle from Williamstown Fine Wines. A funky nose, savoury/animal notes, citrus, juniper and cloves in a pine forest. Tart in the mouth, mild carbonation. YES YES YES this is a great beer. If you are partial to a good Islay Single Malt you will love this beer.
Draft. A golden beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of smoke, and salt. The flavor is acidic with notes of smoke, salt, and malt, leading to a tart finish.

Keg. Hazy/unclear copper with a tiny white head. Smoke and minerals in the nose, earth, wood. Same things in the flavour with some gooseberries, salt, bark, gale. Medium body, salty, sour, little sweetness. Long smokey finish. I like it.
Tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015, blue session. Cloudy yellow body with a small white head. Light hoppy, vinegar notes, smoke. Quite good actually.
[5/1/15] Draught sample at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2015. 2nd session. Hazy yellow. Smoky aroma. Sourish flavor with smokiness, juniper and some fruitiness. Medium-bodied.

Draught @ CBC 2015. Pours yellow with a small white head. Aroma of malt, smoke, baking yeast, smoked meat, sausages, campfire. Flavor is malt, light sourness, baking yeast, smoked meat. Medium body, lively carbonation, light sour finish. 010515

Tap at CBC15! Almost clear golden with a soapy, white head. Aroma has smoke, leather, peat, pale and pilsner malts, hops, spices. Taste is very sour, smokey, malty sweet. Slight hoppy finish. Not as bad as expected..

Bottle thanks to errl! Batch 2 from Dec 2014. Golden orange pour with a small head that quickly fades to a ring. Very unusual aroma. Smoked meat, pool water, sea water, lemon juice, pine and herbs. Taste is very interesting mix of salty smoked meat, tart citrus, and pine. Surprisingly I enjoy it a lot but could see why many would hate this. Very phenolic but it works here. Medium to full body. Very little carbonation. Goes down way easier than it should. One of the most unusual beers Ive had. I love what Jester King does.

Tap at CBC 2015, Copenhagen. Originally rated 20150501. Colour is cloudy orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Smoke, tartness, some sourness and malts. Havent tried real Gotlandsdricke before but I highly doubt this one has anything to do with it.

Bottle, batch 2. Hazy gold with a white head thats soon a coat. Aroma of tart fruit, smoke, some plasticy notes, juniper berries. Alive. Grainy sweetness, some unripe stone fruit, herbs, slightly biting smokiness. Refreshing. Ive no idea what real Gotlandsdrickas supposed to be like, but this is well done - pretty clean and obviously professionally made but retains a rustic and lively feel throughout.

@blue cbc 2015
tart, hazy, better and more clean that the real gotlandsdricka i have tried
Tap @ CBC 2015, blue session. Hazy bronze pour with some head. Lots of peat, tar, smoke and some light fruity notes.
Tap @CBC15. Cloudy plae straw. Strong, herbal and smoke aroma. Herbal flavor, dry and bitter with light smoke.
Sample at CBC 2015. Hazy golden red. Aroma and taste of smoke, grape, citrus. Taste is the same very good.

Sample at CBC 2015. 

Hazy golden/light red with a small head. Aroma and taste of smoke, sausage, light wood and citrus. Also some weak earth. An interesting one and rather tasty.

Pours hazy yellow no head
Aromas of peat, german sausage
Taste has sour notes with snoke and german sausage.
-short review cbc- hazy peach with white head. Smoke, herbs, floral and some citrus. Funk, tart and smoke finish. Overall: enjoyable

Bottle thanks to Sam! Hazy golden pour, small white head. Nose and flavor are crazy and rather awesome, with huge sour, smoke, and herbacious kick throughout. Beechwood a la rauchbier is certainly apparent, but not moreso than undeniable lactic funk. Ginny woody bite complements this bizarre but attractive quaff. Im into it.

Bottle. Pours a hazy gold with a shallow, creamy, fine-grained head. Nose is smoke, lemon, stone fruit, sea salt, and peeled green wood. On the tongue, its mostly smoke and sour; saline, herbal, some honeyed sweetness, a touch of fruit, and earthiness rounds it out. Creamy yet sharp on the palate, with a long, acetic finish. I dont get much juniper, though theres a ghost of it in the close. I dont know if I can say good, but Ill assuredly say fascinating.

Bomber. Thanks to mike12da. Bacony, smoky nose, a bit sourish with some stinky herbal notes, creosote, and tuna fish. Hazy apple juuice color. Sour fruit initial, moves to a sweet peachy flavor with some light spice, then some smoke and funk, and later celery and wheat. Thin-medium body. Wow! Very uusual and complex. Nice tartness, but not a pucker monster -- just very pleasant. Couldnt drink this everday, but it is a special brew.

750 ml bottle. Deep, cloudy, glowing orange. Great nose: smoke, berries, grapefruit, lemonade. Very tangy, lightly sour, berries, bacon, salt. Nice blend of smoke and sour with a pretty strong bitterness as well. Complex and wacky, though it comes together very well.
